name: connoted
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
connote
If a word, object, or situation connotes something, it makes you think of a feeling or an idea that is more than its basic meaning: To me, chocolate connotes pleasure and indulgence. The number 8 connotes prosperity in Chinese. See
connotation
More examplesFewer examplesTo most people, the name connotes surprise, enigma, and even creativity.The word "warrior" connotes honour and bravery as well as fierceness in battle.Inclusion of a word in a dictionary does not connote approval.
